edu.brown.cs.smayfiel.bacon

Class Actor

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.brown.cs.smayfiel.bacon.Actor
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Entity, Nodeable

    public class Actor
extends Object
implements Entity, Nodeable
    Class that contains an Actor. It only queries the database for information as it is needed to keep the runtime down. Implements Entity so Actors can be stored in the ID cache, and implements Nodeable so Actors can act as nodes in a graph and be searched with Dijsktras. Nodeable specifies quite a few methods, but it seems that the way the project is set up, many of the things a future implementer might want to do would revolve around storing information in a graph-like way, so Actors are set up to be graph nodes.
    Author:
    smayfiel

      • getName

        public String getName()
        If name wasn't set by the above mutator, when the user asks for a name that database is queried. This will only happen once, when the name is null the first time through.
        Specified by:
        getName in interface Entity
        Specified by:
        getName in interface Nodeable
        Returns:
        the name of the actor

      • getMovies

        public List<Movie> getMovies()
        Accessor for movie list. This db query is independent from the one above, so the movie list is only produced when absolutely needed. The db is only called once, then the movie list is stored in an ivar. Additionally, before a new Movie is created, this method checks the cache. If a movie with the same ID already exists, this is added to the movie list instead.
        Returns:
        list of movies this actor is in

      • setEdges

        public void setEdges(List<Edge> edges)
        Mutator for list of Edges, which contain an Edgeable object and two Nodeable references. This method is currently only used for testing, but would be useful if a user wanted Edges not based on Movies.
        Specified by:
        setEdges in interface Nodeable
        Parameters:
        edges - the new list of edges

      • getEdges

        public List<Edge> getEdges()
        Accessor for list of edges. If edgeList is null, this goes through the movie list and finds every movie-actor combination that constitutes a valid bacon pass and adds it to the edgeList.
        Specified by:
        getEdges in interface Nodeable
        Returns:
        the list of valid outgoing edges

      • isValidPass

        public boolean isValidPass(Actor a)
        Determines if a bacon pass between this Actor and another Actor is valid. Currently, this means that the fist letter of this actor's last name is the same as the first letter of the next actor's first name.
        Parameters:
        a - the next actor
        Returns:
        true if the pass is valid, false otherwise
